intro: Catabrosella humilis subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered catabrosella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, small flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
